name: Novotel Gdansk Centrum

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We thought this hotel was excellent. Booked it on Hotels.com and managed to get a great deal for £80 for the 3 nights for a room with a fridge, sofa, TV and queen size bed. Both the room and bathroom were in pristine condition and were very modern. I have always found that you walk into a beautiful reception and your room just doesn't live upto expectations but here its the other way round. The reception is very out-dated but the staff are lovely and speak great English. The location was also perfect with only a 5 minute walk to the main part of town (it was snowing so it would prob. take even less time normally). This hotel would be great for a drinking holiday as its only a short toddle back to bed after a night out drinking strong Polish beer but would also suit families as the rooms are quite large!
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Landed Sunday morning at Gdansk airport and took a taxi to the hotel since is was 50 min wait untill the bus would be there. Paid 75 Zloty for the taxi ride, which I found rather expensive as I had no luggage. Maybe it was because it was Sunday.
reviews.title: Good location decent quality

reviews.text: At the hotel I was greeted by the receptionist. I was in luck, and got my prepaid room as early as 10AM, very good. The room was spacious, had a minibar, water heater and a safe (free of charge). There was a sofa and a large bed in the room, and a smart desk, which easely could be turned in to a table for two (se pictures). My television set stopped working after one day, but the receptionist had sorted it out the next day when I came back to the hotel.
reviews.title: 30 Euro for one night hotel parking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I didn't pay for breakfast at the hotel, as I found it a bit expensive. There are many nice cafe's just 5 minutes walk from the hotel in Gdansk old town, which is very nice.
reviews.title: Good location, decent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just stayed 3 days in Novotel Gdanks Centrum in April during our holidays in Poland and were quiet satisfied with the hotel.
reviews.title: Good and central

likes.disliked: — 70's charme of the building and the lobby and corridors

reviews.title: Clean, with Great location
reviews.text: The building itself is a typical 70s building and the location close to a city highway doesn't make it a very attractive hotel on first sight. The lobby and corridors are no better. But once you enter the room its another world. Newly refurbished in a modern style with all amenities you need: Flat screen TV, coffee making facilities, litte fridge, safe, air condition etc. The room is simply faboulous and quite big. The bed is very comfortable and the bathroom well sized with a good shower. Our room was towards the end of the corridor on 2nd floor, so the noise from the highway wasn't disturbing us as long as we kept the windows closed. A big asset of the hotel is the vicinity to the old town. Its merely just around the corner and this is very convenient. They also have a secured parking lot, but you have to pay for it extra. We did not eat in the hotel, so I cannot comment on this. But with the old town so near I would not recommend it either.

reviews.title: OVER PRICED
reviews.text: Overall we enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend it and suggest not to be put off by the 70's charme, its still a Novotel.

reviews.title: Comfortable
reviews.text: A bargain with clean rooms and a great free buffet in the morning. Super location if your visiting old town.

reviews.title: Nothing special; good size rooms
reviews.text: The location was very good. The breakfast was great-and the room was okay-although I don't think shower/bathtub had been cleaned between guests. They were also doing construction in the room next door beginning at 9am. I would advise you find a cheaper hotel with more personality-which shouldn't be hard in this city.

The hotel was excellently located in relation to the Gdansk Old Town, maximum 5 minutes walk to the Green Gate. Was good value for money, breakfast more than adequate and the hotel staff were helpful and spoke good English. Also we were provided with the 'Gdansk in your Pocket' guidebook for free which is invaluable. No complaints, other than our room wasn't made up on Easter Sunday which wasn't a major problem (this is all that stopped me from giving the hotel 5 out of 5). Apart from that really happy with our stay. Great city too, recommended! For info, taxi from the airport to hotel cost 60 Zloty.
reviews.title: Great location, good value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a 2 night midweek break in Gdansk. Stayed at the Novotel Centrum which is everything you'd expect from a Novotel-clean, contemporary (if refurbished), good reception staff, decent breakfast and a little 70's around the edges. Top marks go to reception staff who allowed us to keep on our room for an additional 4 hours following a very messy night out on the (EEEEVVVIIILLLLLL) Goldwasser after which I was very ill. I would not have fared well on the freezing streets of Gdansk waiting to go back to the airport whilst vomiting violently. Thats all I'll say. So a massive thank you to the staff on reception for that.
reviews.title: Good central hotel-clean, but don't expect lovely scenery!!!!

likes.disliked: — Awful view from the room we had, rather dated and dangerous looking lift.

reviews.text: Rooms are lovely and clean, contemporary following a refurbishment with nice bathrooms with shower only. Towels plentiful and changed daily, along with tea and coffee making facilities.
reviews.title: A very nice hotel

likes.liked: — The rooms were very clean and functional

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast very continental with a few cooked items (eggs-fried and boiled, huge baked beans, sausages of some sort and bacon), lots of bread and jams etc.
reviews.title: Convenient Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I noticed that a lot of the reviews on this hotel urge you to ask for a room which does not overlook the busy dual carriageway and I see why. Our room faced the dual carriageway and although the noise didnt bother us too much at night it was definately the awful eyesore of a view that disturbed us most!!! Gdansk is very industrial and also very ugly in parts. The old town is beautiful and of course that is what all tourists decide to see when they choose to visit Gdansk, but this hotel does not really have a nice view regardless of which side of the city you overlook from your room. We must have had the short straw when it came to rooms with a view as all we could see from our window were several very high, very ugly blocks of flats painted in some garish shade of orange or brown lining a tributary of the Motlawa river, the dual carriageway through Gdansk to the right of us over a run down looking subway and the roof of the hotel restaurant. But at the endof the day, who looks out of their hotel window when there's far better things to see and do outside? Don't choose this hotel for the view, choose it for the fact that its central, fairly cheap to stay at, clean and friendly.
reviews.title: Good location...once you get used to it!
Good location, but expensive for what it has to offer
reviews.text: Stayed at the hotel on August 21-22. Out of 6 hotels we stayed at during our 2-week journey this one impressed us the least.

description: The Novotel Gdansk Centrum is located on Granary Island in the seaport city of Gdansk. Spend a weekend or short break at the Novotel, located in the Old Town, and discover the rich history of the city through its monuments and museums. Summer holidays are the perfect time to enjoy the beach, water sports and boat trips in Gdansk. For business travellers, we offer WiFi internet and five conference rooms for up to 300 people. The hotel also features a restaurant, bar and onsite parking.
